duties_responsibilities.duty: Lead, mentor, and conduct performance evaluations for a team of engineers and fabricators.
Craft a comprehensive CEMS strategy aligned with our company's goals and customer requirements.
Develop, implement, and oversee engineering processes, promoting efficiency, quality, and compliance.
Oversee the planning, design, development, and fabrication of CEMS solutions.
Establish rigorous processes for ensuring product quality and conduct thorough testing before installations.
Prepare and manage project budgets, optimizing resource allocation and cost-effectiveness.
Maintain a deep understanding of industry regulations and emission standards, ensuring that all our installations provide accurate and reliable data.

Proactively comprehend and skillfully manage the expectations and requirements of various stakeholders, including customers and technology vendors, fostering strong relationships, and ensuring effective communication to meet mutual objectives.

education_certification.credential: Bachelor's degree in Engineering (Mechanical, Electrical, or related field). A master’s degree is a plus. Electrical Engineering is highly preferred.
